thread.title: John Lynch tested the 49ers to see if they could not leak info
thread.title_full: John Lynch tested the 49ers to see if they could not leak info

author: Jordan Heck (jordan.heck@performgroup.com)
title: John Lynch tested the 49ers to see if they could not leak info
text:
February 2, 2017 8:49am EST February 2, 2017 8:49am EST American Football, News, English, NFL, San Francisco 49ers Good job, San Francisco, you passed! John Lynch (Getty Images) 
Updated at 8:49 a.m. ET 
Updated at 8:49 a.m. ET 
In today's NFL, pretty much nothing is a surprise by the time an official announcement comes. Someone from within an organization leaks the information to Adam Schefter or Ian Rapoport before it happens, and then we wait for it to become officially official. 
But when the 49ers hired John Lynch as their GM, it was a total surprise — because he wasn't even rumored as a candidate. His decision seemed to come out of nowhere, and it turns out, that was the plan all along. 
MORE: John Lynch details how he became 49ers GM 
“I made a big deal that this stayed quiet,” Lynch said Wednesday on KNBR radio in San Francisco. “First of all, you know what I was doing? Part of the rumors are things fly out of that building. So I wanted to see could I trust this building, you know? And so that was part of my thinking.” 
Lynch noted the organization had a reputation for leaking information, so he tested the franchise to keep this a secret until it was time to announce. It's pretty safe to say San Francisco passed with flying colors. Watch This
